result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Madison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 4:00 PM on 8/11/16.

miscConds.notes:
08/29/2016 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS RESTITUTION TO BE SET AT $0.00. 
Restitution to be determined at the Restitution hearing scheduled for 9/1/2016 at 8:00 AM.

$1000.00 cash bond to be applied towards Restitution and costs (Restitution if any to be paid first - No distribution until after the Restitution hearing on 9/1/16). 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no contact with D.L.W. d/o/b February 4, 1996.

Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence, as long as he is not required to register as a sex offender.
12/26/18 AMENDED: COURT FINDS THE DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNCTION.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must undergo a psycho-sexual evaluation and follow through with any recommendations if there are any. After the evaluation in conducted and treatment is completed if treatment is required, a hearing will be scheduled to determine if the Defendant shall be required to register as a sex offender. Probation agent to set up a hearing once the evaluation and treatment is completed, but to be held prior to the Defendant's discharge from probation.
12/26/18 AMENDED: COURT FINDS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION IS NOT REQUIRED AT THIS TIME.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants work release. Must report to jail 12/1/2016. 
Court grants 1 day credit if revoked from probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions (excluding jail)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Madison

records.addlTxt: 03:22 PM Defendant David J Madison in court.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alyssa Maureen appears on behalf of DOC.  Exhibit 1 - Sex Offender Assessment - offered by state, received by court.  Court orders exhibit 1 be sealed.  Court relates.  Ms. Maureen relates.  Mr. Madison relates.  Court relates and finds that there is not a basis to impose sex offender registration at this time. JOC to be amended to reflect sex offender registration is not required at this time.  State relates and objects to expunction.  Court relates and finds that based on JOC, DE has not met the requirements to qualify for for expunction.   Court does not grant expunction in this case.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller by telephone.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent in court.
Court relates.  Defendant is not contesting Attorney Biller's motion to withdraw.  Court grants Attorney Biller's motion to withdraw.  Court questions David Madison.  Court relates.  State relates.  Court instructs David Madison to sign release today and resets hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Adjustment Number: 18A 061889, Payable Number: 106011, Receipt Number: 18R 010533, Amount: $20.00
Removed Public Defender - Mr. Madison intends on hiring his own counsel.
Removed Attorney Krische, added State Public Defender and added PO Morine so the correct parties get notice of upcoming hearing.
to Judge from DOC regarding expunction.

ADDRESS INFO for David J Madison
Current: 624 190th Avenue, Balsam Lake, WI 54810 United States  (Effective: 09-05-2018)
Prior: 1412A 13th Street, Barron, WI 54812

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to amend JOC to reflect $0.00 restitution and 8/26/16 Letter from ADA O'Boyle requesting restitution be set at $0.00.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:30  Court relates and gives appearances.  
2:36  State gives recommendation
2:39  Atty. Krische makes argument.
2:49  David Madison makes statement.
2:49  Court relates.  
3:12  State indicates victim is requesting restitution of $150.  Atty. Krische requests additional information regarding restitution request.  Restitution hearing set for.

SW on each count
2 year probation
Undergo psycho-sexual offender evaluation and follow through with any recommendations if there are any.  After evaluation is conducted, and treatment is done if required, hearing will be set to see if defendant shall register as a sex offender.  PO to set up hearing once evaluation-treatment is completed, but to be held prior to defendant's discharge of probation.
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.
Pay court costs on each count to include DNA surcharge.
Restitution hearing set for 9/01/16 at 8:00 AM
20 days jail (on count #1) with work release; report to jail 12/01/16  (one day jail credit if revoked)
Expunction upon successful completion of probation, as long as he is not required to register as a sex offender.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge (First pay restitution if any).  No distribution until after the restitution hearing.
Defendant must have no contact with D.L.W.  dob2/04/96

$1000 posted to apply to any restitution and costs.
Report to probation by 4:00 PM on 8/11/16

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM on 8/09/16  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend count 1 to 2-counts of 4th degree sexual assault per statute 940.225(3m) - class A misdemeanors. Court grants amendments. 
Defendant pleads guilty to both amended counts. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Sentencing hearing scheduled. Jury trial cancelled. Bond continues. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No agreement to date. JT remains.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No agreement.  2-day JT 6/27 & 28 #1 - Motions to be filed within 10 days.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische by phone.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Not guilty plea entered.  Court grants 10 days from receipt of discovery to file motions.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
10/21/15 Letter from Attorney Krische requesting a not guilty plea be entered on the defendant's behalf.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Defendant David J Madison in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:02 Detective Mary Dexter, Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
1:10 Cross by Attorney Krische.
1:14 State moves for bind over.
1:15 Argument by Attorney Krische.
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.

  Arraignment scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with D.L.W.,  dob: 02/04/1996.

Defendant David J Madison in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant David J Madison in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
